result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo T Battles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  Payable during period of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs, alcohol or weapons.
No contact with Brian P.

timeConds.notes: Release for work, school and childcare.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Denis John Stingl for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:  
*Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with release for work, school and childcare 
*No drugs, no alcohol, no weapons
*No contact with Brian P.
*Maintain employment
*Complete GED/HSED 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, payable during the period of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges payable during the period of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing submissions of defense;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing, Court is in trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard for Branch 7.
As to Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is in trial in another court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Brandon Wigley for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
No dangerous weapons

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.P.    AND/OR  their place of residence    AND/OR  their place of employment

Defendant Angelo T Battles in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-045

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
